definition: to knock against/to bump into/to run into/to meet by accident
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Not now, not since I bumped into him again.
sentences.chinese: 現在沒有，從我再次撞見他以來都沒有。

sentences.english: Just left, Lin Ying baby bump into the village.
sentences.chinese: 剛剛離開時，林嬰嬰就撞見了騰村。

sentences.english: We bumped into each other when we were shopping in the Trust Mart.
sentences.chinese: 我們倆都在好又多購物時，撞見了彼此。

sentences.english: I bumped into my ex-boyfriend the other day in the street.
sentences.chinese: 我前幾天在街上撞見了我的前男友。

sentences.english: It was embarrassing for him to bump into one of his ex- girlfriends last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上撞見其中一個前女友真是讓他尷尬。

sentences.english: Just a little, but caught wind says to want to forget himself, and cause contacts.
sentences.chinese: 只是阿一卻撞見小風說要遺忘本人，和大業交往。

sentences.english: I ran into her last year on Madison Avenue in midtown.
sentences.chinese: 我去年還在市中心的麥迪遜大道上撞見她。

sentences.english: I go home, and when I get there, I find my wife in bed with the gardener.
sentences.chinese: 回到家後，撞見我妻子和園丁在牀上鬼混。

sentences.english: On my way to office, I came across something interesting.
sentences.chinese: 我在上班的路上撞見了一件有趣的事。

sentences.english: Junjie caught horse standing in line to buy tickets in the supermarket of the PP.
sentences.chinese: 俊傑在超市裏撞見在排隊買馬票的PP。

sentences.english: Shu ping to show jade to gather the absorbtion bump into ancient books yu mei with walking.
sentences.chinese: 淑萍跟秀玉採海菜時撞見古韻書帶毓梅散步。

sentences.english: Is you covertly goes to and her appointment feared the wife bumps into woman.
sentences.chinese: 就是你偷偷摸摸地去和她約會又怕妻子撞見的女人。

sentences.english: The policeman caught Soapy stealing the money from the old lady.
sentences.chinese: 那個警察撞見了蘇比在偷那位老太太的錢。

sentences.english: His father caught him filching apples.
He was found desperately trying to untangle several reels of film.
sentences.chinese: 他被撞見拼命想要解開幾盤纏在一起的膠捲。

sentences.english: If we run into her at the mall, I don't even want to talk to her.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們在商場裏撞見，我可不願意搭理她。

definition: to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
to chat and laugh/to crack jokes/to banter
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
